claim: If no safety-car periods had occurred that season, the driver who ended with exactly 91 points would have surpassed 100 points.
extra_info: victories refer to wins; 91st refers to points
reasoning: This is a counterfactual claim ('If no safety-car periods had occurred...would have surpassed 100 points'). It describes a hypothetical scenario about what would have happened under different conditions. The database only records what actually happened in F1 races and cannot verify or refute what would have occurred without safety cars. Additionally, the database contains no safety car data (out-of-schema). Counterfactual claims are always NOT ENOUGH INFO.

content.text:
I need to carefully analyze this claim before querying the database.

**Claim Analysis:** "If no safety-car periods had occurred that season, the driver who ended with exactly 91 points would have surpassed 100 points."

This is a **counterfactual** claim. It asks what *would have happened* under a hypothetical scenario ("If no safety-car periods had occurred"). The database records what actually happened in Formula 1, not what would have happened under alternative conditions.

Even though I can verify whether a driver ended with exactly 91 points, the core assertion — that this driver "would have surpassed 100 points" without safety cars — requires reasoning about a hypothetical alternate timeline. A database of historical results cannot verify or refute what would have happened if safety cars hadn't been deployed.

Additionally, let me check whether the database even contains safety car information:

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

tool_use_result.stdout:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

input.description: Check schema of results and races tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE results
(
    resultId        INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId          INTEGER default 0  not null,
    driverId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    constructorId   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    number          INTEGER,
    grid            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    position        INTEGER,
    positionText    TEXT    default '' not null,
    positionOrder   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    points          REAL   default 0  not null,
    laps            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    time            TEXT,
    milliseconds    INTEGER,
    fastestLap      INTEGER,
    rank            INTEGER default 0,
    fastestLapTime  TEXT,
    fastestLapSpeed TEXT,
    statusId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId),
    foreign key (statusId) references status(statusId)
);
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

    foreign key (statusId) references status(statusId)

CREATE TABLE races

    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,

    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

content.text:
There is no table or column related to safety car periods in this database. The database tracks race results, lap times, pit stops, etc., but has no information about safety car deployments.

This claim is counterfactual **and** references out-of-schema data (safety car periods). The claim asks what would have happened in an alternate scenario — this cannot be verified from a database that only records actual historical results.
